mellanoxNetworkOperator.description: Settings for the Mellanox network operator

enabled.description:
Indicates if the network operator should be enabled
Note that because it uses node feature discovery to run only on nodes
with a Mellanox NIC available, the overhead of enabling this on clusters
that do not need it now but may need it in the future is low
enabled.title: enabled

mellanoxNetworkOperator.title: mellanoxNetworkOperator

enabled.description: Indicates if the metrics server should be deployed
enabled.title: enabled

enabled.description: Indicates if the cluster monitoring should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

alertmanager.description: Enable persistence by default for prometheus and alertmanager

retention.description: By default, retain 7 days of data

The amount of data that is retained will be 90 days or 95% of the size of the
persistent volume, whichever is reached first

Indicates if the NVIDIA GPU operator should be enabled

with an NVIDIA GPU available, the overhead of enabling this on clusters
that do not need it now but may need it in the future is low

ccm.description: Settings for the Cloud Controller Manager (CCM)

Indicates if the OpenStack CCM should be enabled
By default, the CCM is enabled if the OpenStack integrations are enabled
See https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/charts/openstack-cloud-controller-manager/values.yaml

cloudConfig.description:
cloud-config options for the OpenStack integrations

and https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/docs/cinder-csi-plugin/using-cinder-csi-plugin.md#block-storage

Additional storage classes to create for the Cinder CSI

apiServer.description: Settings for the Kubernetes API server

admissionConfiguration.description:
The configuration for the built-in admission controllers
This should be a map of the controller name to the configuration for the controller
admissionConfiguration.title: admissionConfiguration

allowedCidrs.description: Restrict loadbalancer access to select IPs
allowedCidrs.title: allowedCidrs

associateFloatingIP.description:
- 192.168.0.0/16  # needed for cluster to init
 - 10.10.0.0/16  # IPv4 Internal Network
 - 123.123.123.123 # some other IPs
Indicates whether to associate a floating IP with the API server
associateFloatingIP.title: associateFloatingIP

enableLoadBalancer.description: Indicates whether to deploy a load balancer for the API server
enableLoadBalancer.title: enableLoadBalancer

fixedIP.description:
The specific fixed IP to associate with the API server
If enableLoadBalancer is true, this will become the VIP of the load balancer
If enableLoadBalancer and associateFloatingIP are both false, this should be
the IP of a pre-allocated port to be used as the VIP
fixedIP.title: fixedIP

floatingIP.description:
The specific floating IP to associate with the API server
If not given, a new IP will be allocated if required
floatingIP.title: floatingIP

loadBalancerProvider.description: Indicates what loadbalancer provider to use. Default is amphora
loadBalancerProvider.title: loadBalancerProvider

logLevel.description:
Log level
0: Errors
1: Config info and correctable errors (e.g unhealthy node)
2: System state changes
3: Extended system state change info
4: Debug
5: Trace
logLevel.title: logLevel

port.description: The port to use for the API server
port.title: port

apiServer.title: apiServer

authWebhook.description:
API server authentication/authorization webhook. Set this to
integrate into KubeadmControlPlane and KubeadmConfigTemplate
authWebhook.title: authWebhook

extraArgs.description: Any extra args for the autoscaler

cordon-node-before-terminating.description: Cordon nodes before terminating them so new pods are not scheduled there
cordon-node-before-terminating.title: cordon-node-before-terminating

expander.description: When scaling up, choose the node group that will result in the least idle CPU after
expander.title: expander

logtostderr.description: Make sure logs go to stderr
logtostderr.title: logtostderr

skip-nodes-with-custom-controller-pods.description: Allow pods with custom controllers to be evicted
skip-nodes-with-custom-controller-pods.title: skip-nodes-with-custom-controller-pods

skip-nodes-with-local-storage.description: Allow pods with emptyDirs to be evicted
skip-nodes-with-local-storage.title: skip-nodes-with-local-storage

skip-nodes-with-system-pods.description: Allow pods in kube-system to prevent a node from being deleted
skip-nodes-with-system-pods.title: skip-nodes-with-system-pods

v.description: Output at a decent log level
v.title: v

extraArgs.title: extraArgs

image.description: The image to use for the autoscaler component
image.title: image

resources.description: Resource requests and limits for pods
resources.title: resources

filteredNamespaces.description:
Should at least include the values provided to .Values.protectedNamespaces in
https://github.com/azimuth-cloud/azimuth-authorization-webhook/blob/main/chart/values.yaml
filteredNamespaces.title: filteredNamespaces

cloudCACert.description: The PEM-encoded CA certificate for the specified cloud
cloudCACert.title: cloudCACert

cloudCredentialsSecretName.description: The name of an existing secret containing a clouds.yaml and optional cacert
cloudCredentialsSecretName.title: cloudCredentialsSecretName

cloudName.description: The name of the cloud to use from the specified clouds.yaml
cloudName.title: cloudName

clouds.description:
OR
Content for the clouds.yaml file
Having this as a top-level item allows a clouds.yaml file from OpenStack to be used as a values file
clouds.title: clouds

clusterAnnotations.description: Any extra annotations to add to the cluster
clusterAnnotations.title: clusterAnnotations

clusterNetworking.description: Settings for the OpenStack networking for the cluster

allowAllInClusterTraffic.description:
Indicates if the managed security groups should allow all in-cluster traffic
The default CNI installed by the addons is Cilium, so this is true by default
allowAllInClusterTraffic.title: allowAllInClusterTraffic

dnsNameservers.description:
Custom nameservers to use for the hosts
Deprecated; use `clusterNetworking.internalNetwork.dnsNameservers` instead.
dnsNameservers.title: dnsNameservers

externalNetworkId.description:
The ID of the external network to use
If not given, the external network will be detected
externalNetworkId.title: externalNetworkId

internalNetwork.description: Details of the internal network to use

dnsNameservers.description:
List of nameserver IPs to use when creating a cluster network.
This is only used if neither of networkFilter and subnetFilter are given
dnsNameservers.title: dnsNameservers

networkFilter.description:
Filter to find an existing network for the cluster internal network
see Cluster API documentation for details
networkFilter.title: networkFilter

nodeCidr.description:
id: e63ca1a0-f69d-4fbf-b306-31089s1j38d8
name: tenant-internal-subnet
The CIDR to use if creating a cluster network
This is only used if neither of networkFilter and subnetFilter are given
nodeCidr.title: nodeCidr

subnetFilter.description:
id: e63ca1a0-f69d-4fbf-b306-310857b1afe5
name: tenant-internal-net
Filter to find an existing subnet for the cluster internal network
See Cluster API documentation for details
subnetFilter.title: subnetFilter

internalNetwork.title: internalNetwork

manageSecurityGroups.description: Indicates if security groups should be managed by the cluster
manageSecurityGroups.title: manageSecurityGroups

additionalBlockDevices.description:
my.company.org/label: value
Additional block devices for control plane machines
additionalBlockDevices.title: additionalBlockDevices

failureDomains.description:
The failure domains to use for control plane nodes
If given, should be a list of availability zones
Only used when omitFailureDomain = false
failureDomains.title: failureDomains

healthCheck.description:
The machine health check for auto-healing of the control plane
See https://cluster-api.sigs.k8s.io/tasks/automated-machine-management/healthchecking

enabled.description: Indicates if the machine health check should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

spec.description: The spec for the health check

maxUnhealthy.description: By default, don't remediate control plane nodes when more than one is unhealthy
maxUnhealthy.title: maxUnhealthy

nodeStartupTimeout.description: If a node takes longer than 30 mins to startup, remediate it
nodeStartupTimeout.title: nodeStartupTimeout

unhealthyConditions.description:
By default, consider a control plane node that has not been Ready
for more than 5 mins unhealthy
unhealthyConditions.title: unhealthyConditions

kubeadmConfigSpec.description:
The kubeadm config specification for the control plane
By default, this uses a simple configuration that enables the external cloud provider

clusterConfiguration.description:
As well as enabling an external cloud provider, we set the bind addresses for the
controller-manager, scheduler and kube-proxy to 0.0.0.0 so that Prometheus can reach
them to collect metrics
clusterConfiguration.title: clusterConfiguration

kubeadmConfigSpec.title: kubeadmConfigSpec

kubernetesVersion.description: The kubernetes version for the control plane
kubernetesVersion.title: kubernetesVersion

machineConfigDrive.description:
# The key is the name for the block device in the context of the machine
# It is also used to tag the block device, so that the volume can be identified in instance metadata
scratch:
  # The size of the block device
  size: 20
  # The type of the block device
  # If set to "Volume", which is the default, then a Cinder volume is used to back the block device
  # If set to "Local", local ephemeral storage is used to back the block device
  # In both cases, the lifecycle of the device is the same as the machine
  type: Volume
  # The volume type to use
  # If not specified, the default volume type is used
  volumeType:
  # The volume availability zone to use
  # If not specified, the machine availability zone is used
  availabilityZone:
Indicates whether control plane machines should use config drive or not
machineConfigDrive.title: machineConfigDrive

machineCount.description:
The number of control plane machines to deploy
For high-availability, this should be greater than 1
For etcd quorum, it should be odd - usually 3, or 5 for very large clusters
machineCount.title: machineCount

machineFlavor.description: The flavor to use for control plane machines
machineFlavor.title: machineFlavor

machineImage.description: The image to use for control plane
machineImage.title: machineImage

machineImageId.description: The ID of the image to use for the control plane
machineImageId.title: machineImageId

machineMetadata.description: Specific metadata for control plane nodes
machineMetadata.title: machineMetadata

machineNetworking.description:
The ports for control plane nodes
If no ports are given, the cluster internal network is used
See https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-openstack/blob/master/docs/book/src/clusteropenstack/configuration.md#network-filters
machineNetworking.title: machineNetworking

machineRootVolume.description: The root volume spec for control plane machines

availabilityZone.description:
The volume availability zone to use
If not specified, the machine availability zone is used
availabilityZone.title: availabilityZone

diskSize.description:
The size of the disk to use
If not given, the ephemeral root disk from the flavor is used
diskSize.title: diskSize

volumeType.description:
The volume type to use
If not specified, the default volume type is used
volumeType.title: volumeType

machineRootVolume.title: machineRootVolume

nodeDeletionTimeout.description:
The time to wait for the node resource to be deleted in Kubernetes when a
machine is marked for deletion
nodeDeletionTimeout.title: nodeDeletionTimeout

nodeDrainTimeout.description: The time to wait for a node to finish draining before it can be removed
nodeDrainTimeout.title: nodeDrainTimeout

nodeLabels.description: Labels to apply to the node objects in Kubernetes that correspond to control plane machines
nodeLabels.title: nodeLabels

nodeVolumeDetachTimeout.description: The time to wait for a node to detach all volumes before it can be removed
nodeVolumeDetachTimeout.title: nodeVolumeDetachTimeout

omitFailureDomain.description: Indicates whether the failure domain should be omitted from control plane nodes
omitFailureDomain.title: omitFailureDomain

remediationStrategy.description:
The remediation strategy for the control plane nodes
We set these so that we don't keep remediating an unhealthy control plane forever

maxRetry.description: The maximum number of times that a remediation will be retried
maxRetry.title: maxRetry

minHealthyPeriod.description:
The length of time that a node must be healthy before any future problems are
considered unrelated to the previous ones (i.e. the retry count is reset)
minHealthyPeriod.title: minHealthyPeriod

retryPeriod.description:
The amount of time that a node created as a remediation has to become healthy
before the remediation is retried
retryPeriod.title: retryPeriod

remediationStrategy.title: remediationStrategy

serverGroupId.description: The ID of the server group to use for control plane machines
serverGroupId.title: serverGroupId

blockDevice.description:
The block device configuration for etcd
If not specified, the root device is used
blockDevice.title: blockDevice

dataDir.description:
The data directory to use for etcd
When a block device is specified, it is mounted at the parent directory, e.g. /var/lib/etcd
This is to avoid etcd complaining about the lost+found directory
dataDir.title: dataDir

extraArgs.description: Any extra command line arguments to pass to etcd

heartbeat-interval.description:
Set timeouts so that etcd tolerates 'slowness' (network + disks) better
This is at the expense of taking longer to detect a leader failure
https://etcd.io/docs/v3.5/tuning/#time-parameters
heartbeat-interval.title: heartbeat-interval

listen-metrics-urls.description: Listen for metrics on 0.0.0.0 so Prometheus can collect them
listen-metrics-urls.title: listen-metrics-urls

quota-backend-bytes.description: Set a slightly larger space quota than the default (default is 2GB)
quota-backend-bytes.title: quota-backend-bytes

extraArgs.title: extraArgs

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

kubeNetwork.description: Values for the Kubernetes cluster network

pods.description:
By default, use the private network range 172.16.0.0/12 for the cluster network
We split it into two equally-sized blocks for pods and services
This gives ~500,000 addresses in each block
pods.title: pods

kubeNetwork.title: kubeNetwork

kubernetesVersion.description:
The Kubernetes version of the cluster
This should match the version of kubelet and kubeadm in the image
kubernetesVersion.title: kubernetesVersion

machineImage.description: The name of the image to use for cluster machines
machineImage.title: machineImage

machineImageId.description:
OR
The ID of the image to use for cluster machines
machineImageId.title: machineImageId

machineMetadata.description: Global metadata items to add to each machine
machineMetadata.title: machineMetadata

machineSSHKeyName.description: The name of the SSH key to inject into cluster machines
machineSSHKeyName.title: machineSSHKeyName

nodeGroupDefaults.description:
Defaults for node groups
Each of these can be overridden in the specification for an individual node group

my.company.org/label: value
Additional block devices for node groups machines
Options are the same as for controlPlane.additionalBlockDevices above
additionalBlockDevices.title: additionalBlockDevices

autoscale.description: Indicates if the node group should be autoscaled
autoscale.title: autoscale

failureDomain.description: The failure domain for the node group
failureDomain.title: failureDomain

healthCheck.description:
The default machine health check for worker nodes
See https://cluster-api.sigs.k8s.io/tasks/healthcheck.html
Note that maxUnhealthy or unhealthRange are evaluated per node group

enabled.description: Indicates if the machine health check should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

spec.description: The spec for the health check

maxUnhealthy.description:
We have a control place feature gate enabled which blocks all worker node remediation if
control plane is unhealthy, so should be safe to reset worker remediation threshold to
100% without the risk of runaway remediations.
maxUnhealthy.title: maxUnhealthy

nodeStartupTimeout.description: If a node takes longer than 30 mins to startup, remediate it
nodeStartupTimeout.title: nodeStartupTimeout

unhealthyConditions.description:
By default, consider a worker node that has not been Ready for
more than 5 mins unhealthy
unhealthyConditions.title: unhealthyConditions

spec.title: spec

healthCheck.title: healthCheck

machineConfigDrive.title: machineConfigDrive

machineFlavor.title: machineFlavor

machineImage.description: Default image id for nodeGroup hosts
machineImage.title: machineImage

machineImageId.description: The ID of the image to use for nodeGroup machines
machineImageId.title: machineImageId

machineMetadata.description:
Specific metadata for worker nodes
Can also be specified for each node group

The default networks and ports for worker nodes
If neither networks or ports are given, the cluster internal network is used
The default ports for worker nodes
If no ports are given, the cluster internal network is used
See https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-openstack/blob/master/docs/book/src/clusteropenstack/configuration.md#network-filters

machineRootVolume.description: The root volume spec for machines in the node group

The volume availability zone to use
If not specified, the machine availability zone is used

diskSize.description:
The size of the disk to use
If not given, the ephemeral root disk from the flavor is used

volumeType.description:
The volume type to use
If not specified, the default volume type is used
volumeType.title: volumeType

machineRootVolume.title: machineRootVolume

nodeDeletionTimeout.description:
The time to wait for the node resource to be deleted in Kubernetes when a
machine is marked for deletion
nodeDeletionTimeout.title: nodeDeletionTimeout

nodeDrainTimeout.description: The time to wait for a node to finish draining before it can be removed
nodeDrainTimeout.title: nodeDrainTimeout

nodeLabels.description:
Labels to apply to the node objects in Kubernetes that correspond to machines in the node group
By default, nodes get the label "capi.stackhpc.com/node-group=<node group name>"
nodeLabels.title: nodeLabels

nodeVolumeDetachTimeout.description: The time to wait for a node to detach all volumes before it can be removed
nodeVolumeDetachTimeout.title: nodeVolumeDetachTimeout

serverGroupId.description: The ID of the server group to use for machines in the node group
serverGroupId.title: serverGroupId

nodeGroups.description:
The worker node groups for the cluster
See nodeGroupDefaults schema for details
nodeGroups.title: nodeGroups

oidc.description:
Settings for connecting to the cluster using OpenID Connect (OIDC)
If issuerUrl is not specified, OIDC authentication is not enabled

clientId.description: The client ID that tokens are issued for
clientId.title: clientId

groupsClaim.description: The claim to extract the user's groups from
groupsClaim.title: groupsClaim

groupsPrefix.description: The prefix to append to groups from OIDC, similar to usernamePrefix
groupsPrefix.title: groupsPrefix

issuerUrl.description:
The URL of the OIDC provider (i.e. the discovery URL with the well-known component removed)
e.g. if the discovery URL is https://auth.example.com/.well-known/openid-configuration, the
     given value should be https://auth.example.com
issuerUrl.title: issuerUrl

signingAlgs.description: The signing algorithms that are accepted
signingAlgs.title: signingAlgs

usernameClaim.description: The claim to extract the username from
usernameClaim.title: usernameClaim

usernamePrefix.description:
The prefix to append to usernames from OIDC
Used to prevent collisions with existing names, e.g. service accounts
For example, if the claim specified in usernameClaim contains jbloggs and the prefix is set
to oidc:, then in Kubernetes the user can be referred to as oidc:jbloggs
usernamePrefix.title: usernamePrefix

oidc.title: oidc

osDistro.description: Set osDistro used. ubuntu, flatcar, etc.
osDistro.title: osDistro

projectPrefix.description: The prefix used for project labels and annotations
projectPrefix.title: projectPrefix

registryMirrors.description:
Settings for registry mirrors
When a mirror is set, it will be tried for images but will fall back to the
upstream registry if the image pull fails
By default, use images mirrored to quay.io when possible

docker.io.description:
docker.io:
  upstream: https://registry-1.docker.io
  mirrors:
    - url: https://registry.my.domain/v2/dockerhub-public
      capabilities: ["pull", "resolve"]
docker.io.title: docker.io

registryMirrors.title: registryMirrors

trustedCAs.description: A map of trusted CAs to add to the system trust on cluster nodes
trustedCAs.title: trustedCAs
